full_text: ae ae a Els 2020/KER/177 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ASHOK MENON MONDAY, THE O6TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 16TH POUSHA, 1941 Cr1.MC.No.8545 OF 2019(G) CRIME NO.1792/2012 OF Aluva Police Station , Ernakulam PETITIONERS /ACCUSED NO 1 TO 4: 1 K.P.KUNJU MUHAMMED, AGED 42 YEARS, s/o. PAREED, KAROTHUKUDI HOUSE, PMC NO. XVII/502 NAHAD VILLA, PERUMBAVOOR. 2 K.P ALTYAR, AGED 36 YEARS, S/O. PAREED, KAROTHUKUDI HOUSE, PMC NO. XVII/679, PERUMBAVOOR. 3 K.P SUDHEER, AGED 32 YEARS, S/O. PAREED, KAROTHUKUDI HOUSE, PMC NO. II/332A, PERUMBAVOOR. 4 K.P SHAMEER, AGED 30 YEARS, S/O. PAREED, KAROTHUKUDI HOUSE, PMC NO. II/332, PERUMBAVOOR. BY ADVS. SRI.BIJU.D.NATR SRI .S.GOPAKUMAR SMT .T.M.BINITHA RESPONDENTS/DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1 STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, THROUGH THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER, PERUMBAVOOR POLICE STATION 683 542 2 M/s. ADITYA BIRLA FASHION AND RETAIL LTD., (FORMERLY MADURA FASHION AND LIFESTYLE PRODUCTS), HAVING REGISTERED OFFICE AT 701-704, 7TH FLOOR, SKYLINE ICON BUSINESS PARK, 86-92, OFF. ANDHEREI- KURLA ROAD, MAROL VILLAGE, ANDHERI EAST, MUMBAI, ae ae r Bl CRL.MC.NO. 8545 OF 2019 2 2020/KER/177 MAHARASHTRA 400 059 C.S.HRITHWIK-SR.P.P R2 BY ADV. K.S.SANTHI THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: CRL.MC.NO. 8545 OF 2019 3 2020/KER/177 ORDER Dated this the 06 day of January, 2020 The petitioners are accused in Crime.No.1792/2012 of Aluva Police Station for having allegedly committed offences punishable under Section 420 of the IPC and under Section 63 of the Copy Right Act, 1957. The defacto complainant is a company impleaded as 2 respondent. The company is represented by a counsel and has filed affidavit to the effect that the matter has been amicably settled with the petitioners and that they do not have any grievance against the petitioners. The petitioners do not have any criminal antecedents. A report has been obtained from the Investigating Officer through the learned Senior Public Prosecutor to the said effect. In the result, the Crl.MC is allowed and the entire proceedings as against the petitioners in Crime.No. 1792/2012 of Aluva Police Station stands quashed under Section 482 of the Cr.P.C and the accused are discharged. Sd/- ASHOK MENON JUDGE asm ae ae a Bl CRL.MC.NO. 8545 OF 2019 A 2020/KER/177 APPENDIX PETITIONERS' EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al CERTIFIED COPY OF FIR NO. 1792/2012 OF ALUVA POLICE STATION AND THE COMPLAINT SUBMITTED BEFORE LEARNED JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT I, ALUVA , ERNARULAM. ANNEXURE A2 AFFIDAVIT SWORN BY THE RESPONDENT NO. 2/DEFACTO COMPLAINANT DT. 28/11/2019 ANNEXURE A3 LETTER OF AUTHORISATION ISSUED BY ADITYA BIRLA FASHION AND RETAIL LIMITED DT 14/11/2019 // True Copy// PA to Judge
